text: Diplacus puniceus, commonly known as the red bush monkeyflower, San Diego monkey flower, or mission diplacus, is a species of herbaceous perennial evergreen shrub native to the south-east coastal regions of California. ==Description== The red flowers are produced between Spring and Summer, and are host for various pollinators. The entire plant on average is tall and wide. It is hardy from USDA zones 9a to 11. It prefers well drained, sandy soils with a pH level between 6 and 8. It tolerates drought conditions. ==References== Category:Lamiaceae layneae Category:Endemic flora of California Category:Natural history of the California Coast Ranges
title: Diplacus puniceus
